intro: Blepharis passargei, commonly known as the Cape Bladdergrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Blepharis passargei is adapted to arid conditions and is drought-tolerant.
